alert.note: Alert for Anson; Hoke; Montgomery; Moore; Richmond; Scotland; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Moore, northeastern Scotland, Anson, Montgomery, Richmond, Stanly and northern Hoke Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Sturdivants to 6 miles northwest of Raeford. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Southern Pines, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Troy, Carthage, Badin Lake, Pinehurst, Hamlet and Aberdeen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Boaters on the open water and those camping outdoors are especially vulnerable to the dangers of lightning. Seek harbor immediately and find safe shelter in a nearby building or vehicle.
